data.title: Your Alternate Universe
data.meta_description:
Attention Kmart Shoppers!

In my alternate universe, domestic guru Martha Stewart buys Kmart in 1999, giving the store the "Kmartha" nickname from people...
data.text:
In one of my alternate universes, I'd work for a company that picks up cable TV shows for second-run broadcast TV syndication. After a successful run on Cartoon Network, I'd talk to Cartoon Network, Frederator Studios and Pendleton Ward and some broadcasters at a board meeting about having numerous broadcast TV stations pick up Adventure Time for a second-run broadcast syndication premiere in the primetime TV viewing slot of many local TV stations (competing with the likes of other syndicated cartoons targeting teenagers and young adults, like The Simpsons or Bob's Burgers) after being a successful cartoon on basic cable TV for a few years, as well as give the television audience another chance to watch the show. It would even give cordcutters/cordnevers with an antenna hooked up to their flatscreen TV's tuner a chance to watch the show as well...

Adventure Time would also be dubbed in Spanish. By using the SAP (secondary audio program) button on the remote control to switch from the primary English language to the secondary Spanish language dub, viewers fluent in the Spanish language (or English speakers wanting to learn Spanish) can also watch.

The TV stations in each given market I'd probably get to pick up Adventure Time for a primetime airing on either Friday night, Saturday night or Sunday night (at 7:00 PM or later) would include (in order of Nielsen media market):

New York City, NY: WPIX 11, The CW (Friday night)

Los Angeles, CA: KTLA 5, The CW (Friday night)

Chicago, IL: WCIU-TV 26, The CW (Friday night)

Philadelphia, PA: WPHL-TV 17, MyNetworkTV (Friday night)/WFMZ-TV 69, Independent (Saturday night)
